course_name: Work Placement in Indigenous Australian Studies
description: This course is a supervised work placement with a government department in Indigenous affairs, an Indigenous organisation or another approved workplace focused on Indigenous issues. The duration of the placement is 40-60 hours and a suitable timetable for the placement will be negotiated between the academic supervisors, the work place organisation and supervisor and the student. This course enables students to focus on the integration of real-world experience with course material. Students are required to obtain approval from coordinator before enrolment.
prerequisites: ABTS1000, ABTS2020, or #6 of ABTS-coded courses
